export const metadata = {

<HeroPattern />

# Environmental Variables

## Overview

The AR.IO Gateway allows configuration customization through environmental variables. These variables dictate the gateway's behavior, from block synchronization settings to log formatting. Detailed below is a table enumerating all available environmental variables, their respective types, default values, and a brief description. Note that certain variables, such as `SANDBOX_PROTOCOL`, rely on others (e.g., `ARNS_ROOT_HOST`) to function effectively. Ensure proper understanding of these dependencies when configuring.

## Variables

<Table
  containerClassName="mx-auto max-w-full"
  containerStyle={{ width: '100%' }}
  style={{ minWidth: '800px' }}
  scrollContainerClassName="max-h-[80vh]"
>
  <Table.Head>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Header>ENV Name</Table.Header>
      <Table.Header>Type</Table.Header>
      <Table.Header>Default Value</Table.Header>
      <Table.Header>Description</Table.Header>
    </Table.Row>
  </Table.Head>
  <Table.Body>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">GRAPHQL_HOST</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>arweave.net</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Host for GraphQL queries. You may use any available gateway that
        supports GQL queries. If omitted, your node can support GQL queries on
        locally indexed transactions, but only L1 transactions are indexed by
        default.
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">GRAPHQL_PORT</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>443</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Port for GraphQL queries. Used in conjunction with GRAPHQL_HOST to set
        up the proxy for GQL queries.
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">START_HEIGHT</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number or "Infinity"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>0</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Starting block height for node synchronization (0 = start from genesis
        block)
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">STOP_HEIGHT</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number or "Infinity"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"Infinity"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Stop block height for node synchronization (Infinity = keep syncing
        until stopped)
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">TRUSTED_NODE_URL</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"https://arweave.net"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Arweave node to use for fetching data</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">TRUSTED_GATEWAY_URL</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"https://arweave.net"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Arweave node to use for proxying reqeusts</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">TRUSTED_GATEWAYS_URLS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>TRUSTED_GATEWAY_URL</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>A JSON map of gateways and priority</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        TRUSTED_GATEWAYS_REQUEST_TIMEOUT_MS
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"10000"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Request timeout in milliseconds for trusted gateways
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        TRUSTED_ARNS_GATEWAY_URL
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"https://__NAME__.arweave.dev"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>ArNS gateway</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        WEIGHTED_PEERS_TEMPERATURE_DELTA
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>0.1</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Any positive number above 0, best to keep 1 or less. Used to determine
        the sensitivity of which the probability of failing or succeeding peers
        decreases or increases.
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">INSTANCE_ID</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>""</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Adds an "INSTANCE_ID" field to output logs</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">LOG_FORMAT</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"simple"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the format of output logs, accepts "simple" and "json"
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">SKIP_CACHE</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, skips the local cache and always fetches headers from the node
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">PORT</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>4000</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>AR.IO node exposed port number</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        SIMULATED_REQUEST_FAILURE_RATE
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>0</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Number from 0 to 1, representing the probability of a request failing
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">AR_IO_WALLET</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>""</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Arweave wallet address used for staking and rewards
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ADMIN_API_KEY</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Generated</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        API key used for admin API requests (if not set, it is generated and
        logged into the console)
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ADMIN_API_KEY_FILE</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Generated</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Alternative way to set the API key used for admin API requests via
        filepath, it takes precedence over ADMIN_API_KEY if defined
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">BACKFILL_BUNDLE_RECORDS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, AR.IO node will start indexing missing bundles
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">FILTER_CHANGE_REPROCESS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, all indexed bundles will be reprocessed with the new filters
        (you can use this when you change the filters)
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        ON_DEMAND_RETRIEVAL_ORDER
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>s3,trusted-gateways,chunks,tx-data</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Data source retrieval order for on-demand data requests
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        BACKGROUND_RETRIEVAL_ORDER
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>chunks,s3,trusted-gateways,chunks,tx-data</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Data source retrieval order for background data requests (i.e.,
        unbundling)
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ANS104_UNBUNDLE_FILTER</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>{`{"never": true}`}</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Only bundles compliant with this filter will be unbundled
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ANS104_INDEX_FILTER</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>{`{"never": true}`}</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Only bundles compliant with this filter will be indexed
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ANS104_DOWNLOAD_WORKERS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>5</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the number of ANS-104 bundles to attempt to download in parallel
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ANS104_UNBUNDLE_WORKERS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>0, or 1 if filters are set</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the number of workers used to handle unbundling
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        DATA_ITEM_FLUSH_COUNT_THRESHOLD
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>1000</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the number of new data items indexed before flushing to stable data
        items
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        MAX_FLUSH_INTERVAL_SECONDS
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>600</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the maximum time interval in seconds before flushing to stable data
        items
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        WRITE_ANS104_DATA_ITEM_DB_SIGNATURES
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the data item signatures will be written to the database
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        WRITE_TRANSACTION_DB_SIGNATURES
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>true</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the transactions signatures will be written to the database
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        ENABLE_DATA_DB_WAL_CLEANUP
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the data database WAL cleanup worker will be enabled
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        ENABLE_BACKGROUND_DATA_VERIFICATION
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, unverified data will be verified in background
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        MAX_DATA_ITEM_QUEUE_SIZE
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>100000</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the maximum number of data items to queue for indexing before
        skipping indexing new data items
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ARNS_ROOT_HOST</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>undefined</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Domain name for ArNS host</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">SANDBOX_PROTOCOL</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>undefined</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Protocol setting in process of creating sandbox domains in ArNS
        (ARNS_ROOT_HOST needs to be set for this env to have any effect) accepts
        "http" or "https"
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">START_WRITERS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>true</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, start indexing blocks, tx, ANS104 bundles
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">RUN_OBSERVER</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>true</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, run observer (ARIO processes), requires WALLET env var to be
        set
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">WALLET</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>N/A</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Wallet jwk file path for observer ario process</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        LMDB_BLOCK_STORE_COMPRESSION
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"gzip"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Accepts 'gzip', 'brotli', or 'none'. Compresses new blocks with
        specified algorithm before storing them in the local header store. Note:
        Changing this after blocks have been stored locally will require re-sync
        or remove local data to apply new compression setting to previously
        stored blocks.
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        LMDB_BUNDLE_STORE_COMPRESSION
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"gzip"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Accepts 'gzip', 'brotli', or 'none'. Compresses new bundles with
        specified algorithm before storing them in the local bundle store. Note:
        Changing this after bundles have been stored locally will require
        re-indexing to apply new compression setting to previously stored
        bundles.
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        LMDB_DATA_ITEM_STORE_COMPRESSION
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"gzip"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Accepts 'gzip', 'brotli', or 'none'. Compresses new data items with
        specified algorithm before storing them in the local data item store.
        Note: Changing this after data items have been stored locally will
        require re-indexing to apply new compression setting to previously
        stored data items.
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        LMDB_TX_STORE_COMPRESSION
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"gzip"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Accepts 'gzip', 'brotli', or 'none'. Compresses new transactions with
        specified algorithm before storing them in the local transaction store.
        Note: Changing this after transactions have been stored locally will
        require re-sync or remove local data to apply new compression setting to
        previously stored transactions.
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        LMDB_DATA_STORE_COMPRESSION
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"gzip"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Accepts 'gzip', 'brotli', or 'none'. Compresses new data with specified
        algorithm before storing them in the local data store. Note: Changing
        this after data has been stored locally will require re-sync or remove
        local data to apply new compression setting to previously stored data.
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        CONTIGUOUS_DATA_CACHE_CLEANUP_THRESHOLD
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>1000</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the number of contiguous data items to cache before cleaning up
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        ENABLE_FS_HEADER_CACHE_CLEANUP
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>true</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, enable header cache cleanup for the fs cache (this will prune
        headers that are older than HEADER_CACHE_CLEANUP_THRESHOLD)
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        HEADER_CACHE_CLEANUP_THRESHOLD
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>2000</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the height threshold for which to clean up headers
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        CHUNK_DATA_CACHE_CLEANUP_THRESHOLD
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>250000</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the number of chunks to cache before cleaning up
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        MANIFEST_CACHE_CLEANUP_THRESHOLD
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>250000</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the number of data items to cache before cleaning up manifest cache
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        ANS104_DATA_INDEX_CACHE_CLEANUP_THRESHOLD
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>50000</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Sets the number of data items to cache before cleaning up ANS-104 data
        index cache
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">REDIS_CACHE_URL</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>undefined</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Redis cache URL for external caching of data items, chunks, and tx
        headers
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">REDIS_CACHE_TTL_SECONDS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>3600</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>TTL in seconds for Redis cache entries</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">AWS_S3_BUCKET</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>undefined</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>AWS S3 bucket to save/retrieve block files</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">AWS_REGION</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>us-east-1</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>AWS S3 bucket region</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">AWS_ENDPOINT</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>"https://s3.amazonaws.com"</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>AWS S3 bucket endpoint</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>undefined</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>AWS S3 bucket access key</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>undefined</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>AWS S3 secret key</Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">MIN_CONFIRMATIONS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Number</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>10</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Minimum number of confirmations needed for a transaction to be returned
        by the /tx endpoint
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">INDEX_BLOCKS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>true</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the gateway will index blocks as they're synced
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">INDEX_TX</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>true</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the gateway will index transactions as they're synced
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">INDEX_DATA_ITEMS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>true</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the gateway will index data items as they're synced
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">INDEX_TX_OFFSET_LISTS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>true</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the gateway will index the chunks of block data and transaction
        data offsets
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ENABLE_MEMPOOL_WATCHER</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the gateway will watch the mempool for new transactions and
        save the txs headers
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">ENABLE_WEBHOOKS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, allows the gateway to act as a client and execute webhooks when
        local state changes
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">WEBHOOK_TARGET_SERVERS</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>""</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Comma separated list of target webhook servers (URLs)
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">WEBHOOK_INDEX_FILTER</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>{`{"never": true}`}</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Webhook events are emitted only if incoming transactions satisfy the
        specified filter
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">WEBHOOK_BLOCK_FILTER</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>{`{"never": true}`}</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        Block webhook events are emitted only if incoming block satisfies the
        specified filter
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">
        PROMETHEUS_METRICS_ENABLED
      </Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>Boolean</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>false</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>
        If true, the gateway will expose Prometheus compatible metrics via the
        /metrics endpoint
      </Table.Cell>
    </Table.Row>
    <Table.Row>
      <Table.Cell className="font-semibold">NODE_ENV</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>String</Table.Cell>
      <Table.Cell>development</Table.Cell>

    </Table.Row>
